I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TOO ANYONE WHO LOVES MUSIC, REVERSE HAREM, OR ROMANCE. 
The Story is a 9 because it isn't anything new,the characters is your standard archetypes nothing too special,  but the overall show is so great its sweet and innocent,the characters personality mix well so there isn't too much drama it's takes away from the show, just enough to keep you watching.
The art and music is fantastic, when there singing and dancing the quality doesn't go down, A-1 Pictures outdid themselves, the songs are great the voices mix well the couldn't have asked for better results from the voice actor's. (i re-watched6 times.)\n\n
The romance it on the lighter side only adding hints, that's the biggest problem as i was going though season 1 and 2, I was always yelling "get to the freaking kissing scene" but due to "rules" that won't happen if that's what your looking for you won't find any in S 1 or 2.\n\n
(There will be a 3rd season in 2015 if you like season 1 and 2)

Note this is just for the first two seasons,since I haven't finished the third yet at the time of writing this.
Otome from what I've seen is really good in anime. Some really think it's terrible and that they do poor adaptations. I disagree with this especially since there is UtaPri. Some sign it off as dumb but there are great elements here I think don't get noticed not that  much. 
Story 8
At first it's simple as they can get and it has a formula that it follows . But there is nothing wrong with that. In both seasons everyone in Starish gets an episodeto themselves and Haruka also gets some focus. Then the rest of the episodes they try to focus on solving the problem. We know the ending at the first moment but we get to see how. And this works greatly. They also balance comedy and drama nicely . Though at times they dont flesh out world elements greatly.That is the only thing that holds the story back from getting an 9 but look past that and you have a great story.


Characters 8.5

Hakura is possibly one of the most overhated characters I've seen. People always sign her off as useless,dumb, and boring. But without her some of the events in the series wouldn't happen, she has a personality, motivation ,goal,and helps people. Plus she develops so in other words she is a three dimensional character who is likable.  The other guys also get development and are likable and well rounded. The side characters are fun to see too. Bonds are strong here and almost everyone is likable. Sadly some sides don't devolp though others do get some development. That's why it's an 8.5 and not a 9.


Animation and art 10

Animation is fluently done,designs stand out ,and it has a color pallet that fits the series. Overall a big highlight to the series. 


Sound 9

There is no dub sadly but the sub is great. Everyone stands out and dose there parts well. The ops and eds are memorable and very nice. The sound track is very good and fitting. The songs the characters sing are great and fit the tone and feelings they have for that song. Overall the sound is great and memorable.


Enjoyment 10

I really love this series. I can see why some wouldn't but I enjoyed it till the end.


Overall 9


I know it's not perfect but I love it despite that. I do think it's worth at least a try if you think it's worth it.

Apparently a lot of people really enjoyed this based on its score, so I'm not going to tell anyone not to watch it straight off the bat. I am however going to leave some notes that I wrote down while watching it and my final thoughts after watching the final episode.
* They made sooo many scenes excessively dramatic (especially the ones that really didn't need to be) to the point where I find myself laughing at what I presume is all the wrong places, not because it's actually funny but because I don't know what else to do because it's so absurd and uncomfortable.
* Istopped in the middle of this anime to read the reviews to see if it gets any better and in a review someone mentioned that the girl's eyes has the color of soup. Now I can't unsee it and it's turned into a show of 6 hungry guys (literally).\n
* The headmaster's constantly on crack, and not in the funny kind of way but in the I hope he gets help someday kind of way.\n
* Not only is he on crack, but he's also creepy AF. He's got cameras and microphones everywhere and when he's not stalking his students from behind a screen, he's personally out and about lurking in a bush somewhere to stalk and/or ambush his students. I guess this is supposed to be like a funny quirk of his or something.\n
* I feel like the thought behind this was probably good, because I like the idea of the anime and the idea of the ending, but I do not like the way they ended up doing it. It's like they took a good thing and amplified it to the point where it's just too much of everything and everyone and SOUP EYES.\n
* Only 2 (the candy colored redhead and the lil' hat guy) out of the 6 hot guys are actually hot. They are also the only 2 whose personalities aren't exaggerated through the roof, but this is all based on personal preference.\n
* As soon as I was actually able to completely ignore the lyrics used, I really started to like the songs. The music's nicely done and there's nothing wrong with their voices. It's catchy.\n
* The art is nicely done. I'll admit that there's a lot of chibi, but I don't mind. It actually helps by taking the focus off the super tense dramatic feeling every once in a while.\n
* The amount of magical beings showing up to help soupy-eyes bothers me since the anime doesn't appear to take place in a magical universe.\n\n
And so, final thoughts after watching the final episode:\n
It's not a romantic anime, but it's not a drama either, yet it's not a comedy. Or it's all of these, I don't even know anymore. All I know is that it's definitely not hentai and I think that's a shame since it's the only thing it would've been really good at. 6 good lookin' guys passing around 1 confused little soup lady until they finally decide to come together like one big happy family and just go for her all at once? 10/10 would watch.

(*INCLUDES MINOR SPOILERS*) Alright, so I admit... I barely watched this show. I couldn't stand it; still can’t. The girl is an absolute loser, she can barely do anything by herself. I'm currently under the impression that she couldn't even read music before entering some prestigious school for MUSIC, so that she could meet a famous singer like an annoying fangirl (at least learn before going, not while you are there). This show reduced to its bare essence is about a girl who can't do very much and to me doesn't seem to able to inspire anyone (if she can't do anything, then how isshe going to inspire anyone?!) manages, despite all her lameness gets six guys to fall in love with her. She's not even pretty. Those eyes *cringe*.


Story: As I said. Haruka, the main character, cannot do very much, doesn't write good lyrics (come on, the lyrics are ridiculous) is horribly naive, and full of indecision (made to look like she's just too sweet, and kind, and adoringly naive to come to a decision in which would displease, God forbid, one single useless person). She manages to get six insanely gorgeous (*snort* well maybe just one) and talented (*hurdurdurdur*) boys to fall in love with her.


Art: I don't like it. I gave it a six because it's not bad per se, but it's not my style. I hate the strange hair colors, eye colors, the strangely matched clothes, the haircuts...the list just goes on. I could live with it though. If this was an amazing anime, the art wouldn't have even been an issue (or at least, not that big of an issue). But it’s not an amazing anime now, is it?


Sound: The music isn't what I would normally listen to. In all honesty I was looking for something like Mozart or Rachmaninoff (Haruka plays the piano for God's sake, doesn't she know at least some of the classics? And no ‘Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star’ does not count). It isn't bad music, and in all honesty, I find it to be engaging and upbeat, but it's not what I hoping for (Going to a prestigious school to practically become a new 'One Direction', hahaha, NO.)


Characters: Well, there are some background to each character, but it seems cliche and doesn't create any empathy with them. Their reasons for their actions aren't fully explained and their reactions are too damn trusting and stupid (e.g.: Haruka and Ittoki (or whatever his name is) met for 1 day, and he's already in love. I don't believe you can fall in love without even knowing ANYTHING about this person). Haruka is portrayed to be too nice for her own good. She is late for her entrance exam to go to the so called "Prestigious-School-for-One-Direction-Wannabees" because she was helping a lost kid find their mother. Now please do not misunderstand, that was kind and very nice of her. I'm happy she did that, but please do not repeat that same kindness at least five times in one episode. No one is that kind. Horribly unrealistic.


Enjoyment: Well...I gave it a four for it's humor, but...their dancing...(*ugghhhh*).


Overall: I DO NOT LIKE IT. There is nothing, I repeat NOTHING, special about this butt trumpet they call Haruka. There is nothing to differentiate this anime among the hundreds of others like it. It's not special. The main character is not a very strong person (although her tenacity is to be admired (I guess) and her perseverance is something to be rivaled (high unrealistic though). It doesn't captivate the audience with anything worthwhile (except for this Hayato guy, but even then...). I'm afraid I cannot recommend this at all.


Sorry for the poor grammar.

I can't say that the story line of UtaPri was the most interesting, it was mostly the voices that made me love the anime. When I first saw this on MAL, I thought it was a typical harem, all the boys competing for one girl, plus the addition of music. I didn't expect much from it, I thought it would be average, I was half-right. It is a pretty average plot, but the characters, the art, and mostly the sound gave an awesome feel to it. This is a great anime in my view, and I will watch the second season!

I found UtaPri to be basically your regular reverse-harem type anime. It's a cast of handsome guys centered around one 'somehow special' girl. Not horribly unique. As far as the story goes, I have to say, there wasn't much to it. No crazy plot twists or suspense to speak of. Everything that happened was pretty predictable, though I will say that except for some slow parts, the story did at least flow well. 
I did find the art to be pretty fun. I would have rated it higher, but the main heroine has some pretty freaky eyes that aren't emulated in any of the othercharacters, and I found that to be extremely off-putting throughout the series. Otherwise, the art features mainly bright colors, and there were very few parts where the art was particularly lacking. I thought the random chibified scenes were cute, too, which was a plus. 


Likewise, the music for this anime was surprisingly good. I know it's supposed to be about boys becoming idols, but the music was still pretty high quality, and the voice actors they chose all had voices that were pleasing to the ear. No weak vocals to speak of, so that was a good thing. 


Overall, I gave this anime a 7. It's not a bad watch, but if you're looking for something particularly engaging, I would suggest going somewhere else. This is a good series if you just want to sit back, relax, and take a load off your mind (oh, and listen to pretty anime boys sing).

This anime I enjoyed for the most part because of the animation and music.
The animation itself is amazing, especially in the intro, all the dance moves, the confetti, the actions are very well animated, the settings are beautifully drawn, the characters' features are crisp and detailed. 
I am absolutely in love with the music, they are stuck in my head. It is anime about music, so it would suck if the music was no unique or interesting. So yes, the music is good in the fact that not only pop chords are used but the melody in each song are very unique and different fromeach other, and most songs being sung by pretty boys with sexy voices, what more can you ask for?! Kya! 


The only let down would be the characters, they are a little typical to most shoujo animes, and out of the guys, there is the one guy with the interesting background story. And the girl is shy and weak, calling to be protected so I found her most boring at times.


The story is good, but contain some flaws. As a musician and composer myself, it is incredibly hard to write music, so to see that music is being pumped out so easily is a little nonsensical. Anyways, it is an anime, so you would expect not everything to work like reality.


Please give it a shot if you are into good looking guys with amazing singing voices though. :) It was overall still very enjoyable to watch!

First and foremost, this is not really a romance series as it is a reverse-harem one.
There's not really much to say about UtaPri so I'll keep myself short.
I'm okay with the general premise, but the whole run is, summed up in 2 words, dull & unfulfilling.
A lot of scenes happen that make no sense and some things happen way too fast and leave you with unanswered questions. Why, how, or when?
The characters themselves don't give you a lot of reasons to genuinely like and care for them, especially with Haruka since she's another example of a main girl that's just there, simply. Each one ofthe main boys got an individual episode which has fleshed them out, but not much or in a way that's immediately obvious.\n\n
The soundtrack is good for idol anime standards, you could say it's fitting at most, but only that much. There are some good tunes here & there though.\n\n
The art is okay somewhat. A-1 is known for making stuff that has a lot of visual appeal to it, but the dancing animations are a distraction and Haruka's eyes, in particular, make her look like a living corpse.\n\n
While I don't like how this series has presented itself like, let it be known that I don't hate it. I like idol anime, at least subjectively, and me not giving the series a hard 1 or 2 in total is thanks to that and I'll give it another shot for season 2. I believe this is a good enough score for it overall, though if you don't love idol anime, don't watch this.\n

First of all, my friends, if you're here for trying to decide whether to watch this anime or not, don't.
I'm not really fine with writing reviews if you don't watch the whole thing, but I'm deeply convinced that this crap isn't going to get better, and I seriously want my 3 hours back.
You're probably wondering why is this so bad? Let me enlighten you.
[Story] Here you get your typical-reverse-harem-cliched dose of idiotic story in which, of course, the main guys all fall for the same girl, which happens to be a kind-hearted, stupid, useless girl that got accepted at a luxurious music academy withoutknowing how to fucking read scores.


[Art] If you don't mind the robotic dance moves and the spasms on their faces while singing, i think the art is beautiful and bright. BUT i need to point out the main character's avocado eyes (when I first saw them, I really thought she was blind).


[Sound] I actually started the anime because I knew Mamoru Miyano was voice acting, and I won't complain, because he did a great job. The other characters voices are on point, and the soundtrack was quite good. However, despite the "songs need heart to be beautiful" thingy, most of them sounded dull or forced. What I can't believe myself is that I got to like the ending theme.


[Character] Now we get to the deep stuff. While the main character is so annoying that she became one of the reasons I dropped the show, there are, thankfully, characters who bring a ray of light into the show, but they cannot overcome the dullness of the main guy, which has, you got it, a depressing past. 


Overall, if you're not a hardcore yaoi fangirl who needs material for fanfiction or someone who gave up on life, don't waste your time watching something I can say ,without doubt, you won't be able to enjoy.

Or, maybe, you could have a cringe challenge with your friends and use this crap as reference.

Where to start with Uta no Prince-sama... An anime that's about composing music and trying to be an idol with the most annoying main character on Earth and the only reason I had to put this anime on pause. Will I drop it? No... But only because I'm waiting for something interesting to happen, though something tells me it won't. I've seen about 5 episodes and I've already had enough of it. The only thing that's good about the anime is the male characters. Even the animation is pretty horrible, even when they're singing and dancing, which is supposed to look good. 
This is theonly anime I've ever had to put on pause because of how not enjoyable it was.


I guess we can start talking about the good, the bad, and the ugly of Uta no Prince-sama.


To note, I understand this is reverse harem. But that is no excuse.


Story (4)


Don't expect to be watching Uta no Prince-sama for the story. I won't tell you about it since the essentials are above for your liking, but it really isn't all that good. Haruka wants to be a composer when she falls in love with a singer she hears. That's about as compelling as it gets, really. She goes to a composing arts school to try and learn how to make music for singers, and the best part is, when she goes, she doesn't even know anything about it and can't even read notes. 


Another boring heroine who can't do anything in the story and needs the side characters to hold her hand. This alone is really boring.


Since there isn't much to say about the story, I guess we can move on.


Art (6)


The art for most of the characters is good, and I admire the details taken into the background characters and the area where the story takes place. The art of the anime is actually pretty good. I can't help but admire many of the male characters, especially Tokiya and Otoya, who look exactly as nice as possible. 


Then there is the animation, which makes the art quality drop dramatically. The animation in this is horrendous. When the characters are singing or dancing, the movements are gimmicky and look very stupid. The lips move very unrealistically when they sing. Dance moves don't look fluid and the arms just swing around. Way to go. 


Sound (5)


Eh... I can't really remember individual character songs and stuff. The sound quality is mediocre and the songs aren't really special. The only song in this anime I can even slightly remember is the ending song. And even then the only thing I remember is the words "Are you ready?" 


I hear people quite liked the music... I don't see what's so great about it.


Characters (6)


I can write down one hundred things that make the male characters in this anime interesting. But that isn't enough to cover the horrible main heroine, where everyone who has watched this anime will entirely agree with me she is absolutely, without a doubt, positively the most stupid person among anime history. People will try to defend this anime and say it's because she's a character from a reverse harem, but even if that is the case, she's STILL the main character. Let's start by writing down what makes this girl so bad.


Everything about her is bad. She has no talent, her eyes are a disgusting mix of color and look very bad, her hair style and general character design is horrible, her attitude is among the worst I've seen, and many other things. She has no personality, not even a little. She has no idea what she's doing and doesn't even add humor to the anime. I was sitting through it and thinking about how much longer I was going to have to tolerate her. I eventually surrendered to the stupidity and went to watch Psycho-Pass instead.


Thinking about this heroine sets my mind on fire. She's just the most clueless person on the face of the planet and constantly just stammers and blushes. Everyone calls her cute and adorable, but go ahead and google her. That's cute? 


The one thing that makes the characters good are the males. They all have some personality, their pros and cons that they need to fix, and actually have singing talent. Their character designs look good and they don't have wunky hair styles and nasty looking eyes that I literally had to look away from the screen to avoid. There are some pretty hot males in this anime, and it was one of, it not the, only reason I started watching Uta no Prince-sama. 


Enjoyment (5)


If you like watching nasty looking anime girls constantly fail and try to be good people, you might like this anime. The only thing I enjoyed about it were the male characters, and their moments are so far and few in between that I couldn't motivate myself to continue. I'm being very generous with this anime by giving it a 5. The main character alone gives this anime a 2 or a 3. Honestly, unless you are among the most tolerant person on Earth, or like stupid clueless females, go ahead and watch it. 


Overall (5)


I'm not kidding when I said I'm being generous for giving this anime a 5. It really isn't all that good. Maybe it's because watching dumb anime girls stammer and try to be good people and fail isn't my cup of tea, but even the story and animation doesn't make this anime better. With humor that's barely added, the anime doesn't keep the audience held on long enough because of the lack of interesting scenes. 


I am not even slightly joking - the heroine ALONE is going to kill your impression of this anime. Every other aspect of this anime is OK... but this heroine needs to go home and never needs to be repeated in another anime because I cannot see how anyone tolerates her.


I lasted 5 episodes and might wait another 6 months before I continue watching it. How long will you last?

Story: 6/10 I like the idea of a music school and training their pupils to become future idols and such. But the story can be extremely unrealistic. At the beginning, Haruka happens to help out a kid and then happened to be late for an exam and then two "nice" guys happened to "help" her. How can that be a coincidences. Plus isn't Itoki Otoya sitting the exam? Why will he be going outside to help a girl and then going back inside? It makes no sense. And if Haruka is actually in a hurry and desperately and seriously wants to take the exam, whywill she even help the girl? I suppose she's just being the stereotypical goody two shoes... (read character, I don't want to risk changing the subject)


Art: 9/10 I personally quite like the art. I like the amount of detail put into the characters and background. The colours used are vibrant and eye-catching. In addition, the expressions can be easily read just by looking at the eyes so we can have an idea what each character might be thinking. However, the animations can be a bit "stiff" at times. for example how the clouds are floating across the sky at a terrific speed when the trees are still. So is there wind or not? Not, the only the background, the characters don't have a smooth animation at times.


Sound: 10/10 I love the openings and endings, and the songs can be quite catchy. The singing is really good as well. The voice actors are also really good singers. But the best part is the background music. The choice of background music clicks in with the contemporary theme and atmosphere. I also really like the voice acting. The voices are neither too high pitched or too low. Usually, females are pitched too high and the males' voices can be pitched too low. When that happens, I usually turn off the volume and listen to something else(preferably Paramore) while reading the subtitles instead because I just don't like high pitched girly voices.


Character: 3/10 I personally think character development is the weakest point. The personalities of each character varies and it is obvious what type of character each of them are. That's mainly because the characters are mainly stereotypes. Like how Masato is the emotionless kid and Haruka is the kind and gentle kid and how Ringo is the "trap" kid so on. The characters in this anime is comprised of nothing, but stereotypes and shallow personalities. I can see that the producers of this anime had attempted to give each guy a dramatic or at least a dramatic-ish type of past just to erase the shallow-ness of the characters. No, giving characters a past does not change the fact that a character is shallow. You'll just need to add more into the personality to refrain a character from becoming a dating sim stereotype, not more into their histories. This only means some of the viewers will rate this show a 10/10 because they're just only going for the looks as this show has decent artwork even though the guys are seriously shallow(yes, I have used the word "shallow" quite a few times but I can't find another word to describe it at the moment). Well, that's what happens in real life anyway. Girls just go for the shallow guys...


I also don't understand why every single guy falls in love with the main character. What's so special about her? She's the usual naive and kind-hearted student in a school. And I mean every. single. friggin'. guy. And what does the protagonist do? Smile off. Hey, there's a whole boy band in love with her. What else can she do? This is like the entire one direction all falling in love with a directioner. Well, apart from the fact that the directioner will squeal and smile instead of just smiling.


This anime is similar to Free. A load of shallow animated guys with real-life girls falling in love with the characters. 


Enjoyment: 7/10 When I watched it the first time, I didn't really enjoy it. Now I'm re-watching it, this anime is actually okay. I don't typically enjoy watching this but I am able to watch the whole two seasons. But I've mostly enjoyed listening to the songs. But I could just listen to vocaloid instead.


Overall: 6/10 Other than the poor character development, this will be a really good anime. Fair plot + awesome music and great voice acting + aesthetically pleasing artwork + crap character development = ???

Like pretty boys? Of course, you do! Well, anyways if you like annoying girls who eyes shake and can't make up their freakin' mind, watch this! I highly dislike the main character, Haruka for her personality. Uta no Prince-sama Maji Love 1000% is an overall basic, generic shoujo anime. This anime contains singing, so if you dislike "musicals", I would recommend not watching this. Overall all, the anime is mediocre and watchable. But in the end I don't know why I watched it. UtaPri~

Hey guys, I don't normally write reviews but I am trying to write more. So here it goes:
I have been debating watching this anime for about a year now. Everyone says it's great, when I am looking at which anime to watch next this one pops up multiple times but I was questioning whether or not it would be worth my time. Most people have listed it as a romance anime so here I figured, "okay a girl gets to choose between 6 guys. We've all seen it before and quite honestly I prefer anime where it is a constant relationship with common ups anddowns apposed to getting a choice. Personal preference." But this was quite the opposite and I was disappointed to see that there was no romance, though you could see some starting to bloom, nothing happened in that field. \n
What i did find though.\n
Story:\n
It has a great story line that is easy to follow and when there is a problem with another secondary character you see their past so that even if the main character doesn't know it yet you do so you can sympathize with both parties.\n
Art:\n
The art was great, there was so many bright colours, which at times could be hard on the eyes but most of the time it made me smile and laugh and cry along with the characters. You know when it's raining outside and it makes you feel gloomy? This anime also portrayed that perfectly .\n
Sound:\n
OMG the sound, I loved almost all of the songs, in the subbed version many known songs (twinkle twinkle little star) was sung in english so we could enjoy it too and sing along. I think there was 2 or 3 songs like that, played multiple times in memories ect. for our enjoyment. Though many songs were sung in Japanese with english subtitles so we too could enjoy the meaning behind the songs. I would re-watch certain episodes of this anime just to rehear the songs, my favorites are the intro and ending songs (hence why they were picked). Also because it is an "arts academy" when people were about ready to burst with feelings, sad or happy and even mad, they sang which I can't really relate to but hearing them sing I wanted to join in, just because.\n
Characters:\n
The main character has so much improvement throughout the anime and honestly I love that, when you are introduced to the character in the beginning of their new environment and you are able to grow with them. The only downside was #1-like I said before no romance (or hardly any) and #2-the secondary characters didn't improve much with personality though their hardships were resolved. \n
Character I liked the least was the director, he popped up at random time with no real reason to show up other than to make peoples lives difficult and I found that he was too much to handle, he entered and exited with a bang leaving your head reeling.\n
Enjoyment:\n
Overall I liked the anime and am looking forward for season 2.\n
I honestly think you should give this anime a shot.

I am dropping this anime for the time being, so my review is based onthe first three absolutely aweful 12-minute episodes.
Don't get me wrong, if you're thinking about watching this, I'm not trying to desuade you from doing so.  However, it really just wasn't my cup of tea and I'm rather bored of the whole thing.  I think I'll just comment on the three chief aspects of this very cliche anime; the art, music, and plot.
I'm not a fan of the art itself, but the colors are rather vibrant and there aren't a lot of short-cuts in drawing like in some other animeIve seen. (drawing chibis every time you arent zoomed in on a character's face, for example).  However, it seems like all the charcters look faintly similar as far as coloring- blue hair, red hair, or blonde hair.  The xception is the man character, whose eyes are a hideous shade of eerie acid yellow.


Being an anime based on a musical boarding school, I wouldn't expect anything but outstanding as far as the sound goes.  The voicing here is a pretty solid OK but the singing is beautiful and the lyrics are that marvelously corny love song stuff aaaaall the time.


As for the plot: I didn't go into this expecting much.  I was basically in it for the whole harem thing, which Im pretty into. However, the characters are pretty typical and the plot doesn't have anything special at all.


Overall, based on my very limited knowledge of the anime, I give it a solidly OKAY rating.

Uta no Prince-Sama is a shoujo showing the life of Nanami in Saotome Academy, the best music academy there to have teachers like the idols of the moment and is full of celebrities but Nanami not know any of them, because in your home has no TV! However, the girl has a unique idol, Hayato and it is because of him that she wants to be a songwriter.
The anime begins with Nanami trying to prove, but as it arrives late the guards not to let in, but Nanami gets help from Otoya and Ren trying to convince them to let her in. In its firstday at school Nanami discovers that serious Masato (another classmate) and Ren celebrities are owners of famous producers. Then Nanami also know Syo, Shinomiya and Ichinose, apparently the twin brother Hayato, the girl idol.


Throughout the anime we get to know better each character and how Nanami enters their lives. In addition, we see the protagonist overcoming its limitations in pursuit of his dream.


I'm not much anime fan with harem, but when it is inverted, ie many beautiful men trying to win a single woman, I even try to watch a little more willingly! Nanami is not a pretty girl super or hyper talented, but his charisma will the little conquering the attention of everyone, especially the most popular boys.


Generally "Uta no Prince-sama" does not show anything new, the plot is a bit obvious and much man for little woman does not convince me because I look like a failure in the novel aspect. Characters can be beautiful, but have characteristics ever seen before: the serious, the rebel, the gentle, funny, the womanizer and excited. These cliches are the only regrets in my view.


Conclusion: this anime is simply five star. I have nothing to complain about(except what I explain before). The story is quite unique and interesting. There are some scenes that make us laugh and others that make us cry. Being a music anime, its soundtrack could not be better. Each of the faces and each of the thousand voices deserve praise, entering a tune with each personality. Another curious fact is that usually anime idols are like "musical protagonists" girls, but Uta no Prince-sama, beautiful guys with wonderful voices (no homo -qq) !!

Okay well, first things first, i would say i 'Fairly' enjoyed this anime. 
One big problem with it was that their favorite quote was 'I like your songs.' and that was killing me because it was repeated in almost ALL episodes, it really left me standing. Well, pulled through and finished the anime and overall, it was great art, great music, but crappy job done with the plot. I wouldn't really recommend it but watch it if you like art and music more than caring about the plot and if you love bishounens (one thing that got me watching XD) but honestly speaking it wasn'tnice, almost every episode has at least someone confessing to the girl about how great her music is and how nice she plays the piano and stuff like that but really, if you don't like those predictable 'as expected' shows i really don't think you'll be able to enjoy this anime. But, as i say, everybody has different thoughts, i personally only liked the art and music and trust me, i was sitting down insulting this anime the whole way through every episode, really. But it's a habit of mine to finish watching anime till the last episode. Well, overall, i'd give it a 5 rating, mostly for the art and music of course XD (sorry to those fans though :] )

The plot development wasn't the best out there, but several other things make up for that.
STORY 8/10
The concept was really interesting and was actually well-developed, but not so much in the first few episodes. Because there were so many main characters, episodes 1-8 were spent almost solely in introducing them and whatnot. Don't get me wrong, I don't mean that the first half of the series sucked, just that what happened then wasn't very relevant to the main point of the story. 
CHARACTERS AND ENJOYMENT 9/10
What made this first half enjoyable were the different male characters. Besides being lovely bishies, they were very likable intheir own way. I didn't dislike Haruka, but she wasn't memorable or a strong enough lead in my view.\n\n
ART AND SOUND 10/10\n
If there's one thing that I absolutely loved about this anime was the soundtrack and the art. The characters were gorgeous, the scenery was beautiful, and the colours dazzling. It was actually one of the anime with the best art I've seen - though part of that may be due to the fact that I watched this in DVD quality. And not only were the songs sung by the characters amazing, but also the sound effects. They were really meticulous, and it showed.\n\n
OVERALL 8/10\n
Overall, I found this a very entertaining anime, and I'd recommend it to anyone who's looking for a fresh anime - especially if you're into arts and music.

When I began to watch Uta No Prince Sama, or UtaPri, I didn't go in with high expectations. I've read all of the negative reviews, but I figured since I was simply looking for something light-hearted and fun I'd enjoy it well enough. Surprisingly, it surpassed my expectations in some ways.
Sound: 10/10
Obviously, one of the most important parts of this anime was the music, considering it's placed in an academy for idols and composers. This was my absolute FAVORITE thing about UtaPri -- each song touched me in some way, and I found myself listening to "1000% Love" multiple times, and humming along each time.If you take anything away from this anime at all, it will be the music. The voice acting was also well done.


Characters: 8/10

This is where most people's problem with UtaPri lies, in my opinion. Haruka, our main heroine, was clearly supposed to be cute. Everything about her was designed that way, from her voice, her klutziness, the number of times she stutters, etc. Many people had a problem with her oddly colored eyes, but I didn't mind them. I figured that Haruka could use the extra flair, because she certainly wasn't memorable. I don't think they failed on making her "cute", per say, but she was ultimately forgettable, even a little aggravating at times. However, she's easily overlooked because of the other cast. The boys were all interesting to me in some way, and even though their personalities were certainly stereotypical and not unique in the slightest, I enjoyed all of them respectively. It was very annoying how all of these boys instantly fell in love with Haruka and were clambering over themselves to introduce themselves to her, but it's a fact that can be overlooked, because frankly that type of thing is in the majority of harems/reverse harems.


Story: 7/10

While decent, the story was nothing special. Typical boarding school reverse harem setting, with the added interest of being a school for idols and composers. If they didn't add that last bit, then honestly the anime would be a lot worse. However, the setting worked out for the better, although it's nothing unique.


Art: 10/10

This one is a given. Being a fan of bishies and shoujo style art, I automatically fell in love with the art style in UtaPri. It uses many bright colors and has an overall happy feel to it. Two words - eye candy. If you're a fan of bishies, then you'll absolutely love the art.


Enjoyment: 9/10

I feel like this needs some explaining. For me personally, I enjoyed UtaPri very much. It wasn't anything special or even attention grabbing, but it was heart warming and entertaining. Although I'm giving this anime an 8 because of it's flaws such as a forgettable main character (often a problem in shoujos), the relative lack of creativity, and the fact that all of the guys instantly loved Haruka, I'm giving it a 9 for enjoyment because it's a quick, light-hearted series that I finished easily in two days. Whether you enjoy UtaPri or not really depends on the type of anime you normally like and how seriously you take it.


If you're looking for something fresh and unique, with a strong heroine and dramatic scenes, then you've come to the wrong anime. However, if you can not take it so seriously, turn off your brain for a bit and let yourself ENJOY the fantastic music and fun characters, then I can surely say that you will like UtaPri.

Dang guyyys. So many 3, 4, 5 O.O. You must really really not like this anime at ALLLLL. xD
Mmmmmm. I'd admit, this is quite a very very typical anime. A lot of the guys falls in love with the main character but the main character cannot choose. 
Even if I have seen this kind of typical anime, I think it's the good looking guys and the music and the animation that I liked the anime overall. The story plot mainly isn't just very good.
I would only recommend this anime to anyone who likes singer/music types of focused anime. And who is kind of a "newbie"to animes who likes these types of anime romance.


Story:

The story is about a main girl, Nanami, who really wants to compose because she has discovered a new music video from Hayato. And from there on, her idol is Hayato because of his one song and her dream is to compose a music for him to sing.

So.. in order for her to pursue her dream, she has to go onto a prodigious school. And while she is learning how to compose, she met 6 guys along the way and she helped them in each episode with their own music problems. That is how each guy felt they have some kind of connection with her since they feel she understands them like no one else.


Overall, it is a cute story :C. But... not a well, planned good story plot since for an anime experience, this story plot is cliche. So that's why it's "Fair" for the most port.


Art:

I feel the art is very good. The way they drew the scenery, the music when the characters sang, the way they drew the characters, were all good for the most part.


The design on how they drew each guy differently was good too, but typical, again.


Sound:

I thought the sound was good. When they sang, the voice of each character was really well played. The opening and the ending theme song was good too.


Character:

The character personality is very typical again.


In almost each anime you see, you'll see at least ONE guy who is the most careless, outgoing person. You'll see at least ONE guy who is the serious type. You'll see at least ONE guy who is the flirty type. You get the point.

Each of these personalities are put into each 6 characters and that's how it keeps me entertained, since I like these types in each anime. It's how the anime keeps on getting interesting.. regardless of the story plot. So I don't mind seeing these personalities all over again and again.


Enjoyment:

Since I'm a girl, of course I would like fan girl all over the place. They seriously made all the guys look cute xD. 

But.. for a guy watching this... errrr, yeah. Don't waste your time then. 


And for my enjoyment, I liked the songs that they sing in the episodes... when each character has their own songs.



Overall, I think this is a fair anime where for a girl, it might be alright, but for a guy, they will seriously hate it because they won't be interested in some cute guys and the main character along the way.

After a while without even caring about this anime, I wanted to finally complete all 13 episodes so I could write a good review. What I didn't know is that I already did. Two years ago. I didn't even remember I'd finished it. That's how bad it is.
Story: 1.
You know, it could have been a great series, but creators must think we are kind of plain.
You may like music and you may like pretty boys too, but you'll find exactly NOTHING else in the whole show. Girl is trying to be a composer and there are a bunch of guys who know how to sing.That's okay.

What's not so okay? Harem. They all love the main girl, who -to put it simply- is kind of pathetic. She's portrayed like the perfect girl. She's the dream of six or seven boys, who (of course) are devoted to her. Come on, that doesn't happen, neither in reality nor anime. (I forgot we are watching reverse harem. Of course). 

The thing I disliked the most about UtaPri wasn't this harem thing. I hated that they all end up being happy. Yes, these boys kind of get sad and jealous and fight with each other when the girl doesn't pay them enough atention, but that's not what I mean. I'm not into sadism or anything, however, people just doesn't get always what they want. This is no paradise. "This is a TV show!", well, people get unhappy in anime too and I hoped that there was a tiny moment when the whole gang wasn't succesful.

And what the hell was that crap at the end of the season?


Art: 9.

I think this was what kept me watching the series till the end. There's color, dynamism, brightness. Characters' desing was great too.


Sound: 4.

Well, this anime is about music. We all love music. So it's supposed to be somehow good. Okay. It's not. I listened to the soundtrack after I finished the series because there was a couple of songs that I liked. While in the anime these songs match with the context, they kinda disappoint when you listen to them without watching the anime. They are all too similar to each other, boring and cheesy and you may feel you are listening to the same song all over again.

Why did I gave it a 4? There was A LOT of music. So I'm sure everyone will find at least one song they enjoy.


Character: 1.

I remember Otoya dearly, but it's the only one.

I cannot help but hate perfect characters, I feel unconnected to them. I know anime characters are not real, but they can be relatable, can't they?

I hated the main girl, I don't even know how she's called. I hated her. She's a cry baby, incapable of standing up for herself, irritating to say the least.


Enjoyment: 1.

At first I thought the anime was going to get better, but that was an illusion. Usually I start and finish one series in three, four days. It took me months to finish UtaPri because I watched one episode and got bored.  I wish I could rewind and drop this anime at episode 1 because it was absolutely terrible.


Overall: 2.

I give a 2 because art was great but it's not worth it. I can't believe I wasted my time watching this, I don't even know how I managed to end it.

Ok, this is my first review so bear with me, guys and if there are any errors or grammatical mistakes, I apologize in advance - English is not my mother-tongue.
For some reason, summertime has always been anime-binge-watching-time and I have watched a lot of anime over the past few weeks. The reason I chose UtaPri as my first review is because I'm completely baffled by the turn this show took.
I might go into spoiler territory here, so if you don't want to know anything before watching this show, you better stop reading now.
After the first few episodes, I was honestly pleasantly surprised. Yes, it isa reverse-harem show and yes, the main characters eyes are so ugly, but after a while you get used to it and even though it's reverse-harem, most of the side-characters are pretty well fleshed out and/or have a decent backstory and even the main story is ok. Not thrilling or exciting, but just ok. 


It's a show about a girl who goes to a prestigious musical school and we are following her on her journey to succes. We see her struggling for a while, interacting with the different guys, working on some music, so far so good.


But then something happened that made me drop this whole anime all together. For some reason, there is one character that can transform himself into a cat and vice versa, he seems to be some cursed prince from a far away land or whatever and the MC seems to be his muse. I seem to remember my first reaction was "Urmpf???" and I had to rewind, because it was like I went from 'Glee' to 'Charmed' in a smooth second.


Now look, I am all for fantasy and even science fiction if it's executed properly, but this seemed so odd and totally ridiculous to me that I had to turn off my tv. It was like they mashed two different anime together. I have no idea why they did that, maybe they will explain in it in later seasons, but I am probably not going to find that out. Like, what are we doing here? Annoying-looking eyes and a lot of guys fawning over one girl while also focusing on music and stardom are all fine by me, but throw in a cursed prince who is also a cat, that's where I draw the line. It just didn't fit and raises all kinds of different questions.


Overall, the music is above average, some of the characters are interesting and if you are really into reverse-harems and highschool-like anime, I would give it a chance. It is not THAT bad. But that "twist" felt so out of place to me that I couldn't take the rest of it serious. It might be an overreaction and maybe I will continue watching it when there is nothing else on CR, but for now it's a no for me. 


Therefore I changed my first grade (7) into a 4.


I like anime so much and there are many shows I watched over the past few weeks that had me either enthralled to the points of insanity or rolling on the floor laughing. UtaPri was a bit of a let down for me.

[THIS IS A SPOILER FREE REVIEW]
Wow. I did not expect myself to enjoy the anime as much as I did. If you have read my other reviews you know that I am strict when it comes to what I enjoy out of a reverse harem (even though I am a girl). Uta no Prince Sama was something I had to force myself to continue watch because I kept thinking "This has to get better somehow". In some way what I thought was true. I still don't know if I can say I like it or not.
The story was definitely unique, but it didn't make mewant to keep watching. Like I said, I had to force myself to keep going. This was also one of those animes where I found it REALLY hard to have sympathy for any of the characters. I kept wondering how Nanami was crying so much when she just met the boys. It made me feel like I had a black heart. Then I realised that this anime is just trying really hard to get me to cry but its failing. Not only that, but there were to many guys. I was having the same problems I came across when I watched Brother's Conflict. I couldn't remember any names! I'm watching the show thinking "That red head guy, oh whats his name? I think it starts with an I". It made my brain hurt.


The art was pretty amazing. It reminded me a lot of Amnesia with its vibrant colors. Besides that the art is pretty straightforward. I need to go ahead and skip to talking about the music because that was pretty much the main point of this show. In most shows I find myself trying not to cringe at the songs they sing. In this show I found so many songs that I liked. For example, the ending song where everyone says "Are you ready?" I am sitting on my couch screaming "OH YEAH I'M READY!".


Where do I begin with the characters. They seemed to bland and not thought out. Don't get me wrong, I really like it when otome games/animes have a variety of personalities. However I feel like this anime tried to do that and failed. I tried to pinpoint which were the tsunderes and I asumed which ones they were. I noticed a couple guys who are weird also. That's all I could really take from the 6 guys who were there. I have seen animes that did a better job with this kind of thing.


So I guess you can say I didn't like this show. There was a little bit of hope I had from beginning to end but I never felt like this anime was for me. Regardless what I say in the review I think I will end up watching season 2. I would definitely recommend this anime to those who like large scale reverse harems and hot boys who do nothing but want YOU. In the end if you are a lonely girl with no boyfriend, this anime will fill you empty heart.

Ah, reverse harem. A section in the anime universe where girls (and guys) can escape to and fangirl over unnecessary fanservice and have their expectations set at an unrealistic rate. I must admit, I am one of those girls, and I'm not ashamed of it. After finishing an action-packed anime, I thought I'd calm things down with this anime, and I was not disappointed. 
If you're looking for a show that has romance, comedy, drama, amazing music, AND a great plot, you're in the right place. 
The art in this show was incredible. Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING, was colorful in a bright and beautiful way thatreally expanded on the cheerful atmosphere that the anime was giving. The design of the characters was also one to be thankful for. Having attractive male leads in a reverse harem is a must have, and this anime did a GREAT job on that one. The way they were designed also reflected nicely on their personalities - such as big, round eyes for Otoya for his bubbly personality, and narrow, sharp eyes for Tokiya to show his dark and somewhat cruel attitude. \n\n
As for the music, all I can say is that every single song that was sung, no matter who was singing, made me speechless. The beats, the lyrics, the instruments used, EVERYTHING was absolutely perfect. Some of the songs that I heard in this show were some of the best J-Pop songs I've ever heard.

So, the songs were bomb. They kind of had to be with the seiyuus in this anime, right?
Um, so the story in this anime was lacking to say the least. Honestly, it wasn't the worst thing I've ever seen, but it didn't really have a direction to speak of until the end. Actually, I think my main issue was that the anime couldn't really pick a genre, which messed up the flow of the story. It was a comedy, it was a drama, it was a shoujo, it was way too much. 
One thing it undoubtedly was, though, was a harem. I'm sure there aresome good reverse harems out there, but this one was very blatant about it. What I mean by that is that you'd have a couple guys that were into this main girl that had a bit of a basis behind why they liked her, but the rest of them? Zero. They would have like one conversation by themselves, and then the guy was in love with her (or her music, whatever, same difference). Harems are unrealistic, and I get that, but it didn't help my enjoyment of this anime. 


The characters were not bad, actually. Stereotypical? Yeah, but still entertaining. Back to the seiyuus, I think the stellar voice acting saved the anime. Other than the needlessly corny bits, I really enjoyed listening to the boys when they were together. 


To be honest? I enjoyed this anime a hell of a lot. I do have negatives, but if I hadn't been looking for criticisms, I would've thought this was a fun (slightly strange) anime. The art was mostly a plus for me. Especially-- and stay with me here-- the hair. The blending that was done on the hair of the characters was really satisfying to see every episode. Although, maybe three redheads is a bit much. The music was, as I said, amazing. In fact, there was a song or two that made me tear up a bit because the circumstances and the seiyuus voice. 


I'll tell you what, though it may be a bit trashy, I'll be finishing the series. I really wanna hang out with these characters more and hear them sing if nothing else. If you're not too picky, or if you love these seiyuus, give this a shot. It may make you cringe, but it may also make you happy. It'll certainly make you wanna break out in song. If that's not enough of a reason to watch it, I don't know what to tell you.

ENJOYMENT: Oh the bishies. They're so yum. And the show moves so quickly that it's hard to stop and wonder if you're enjoying it or not. 
STORY: Innocent girl raised by her grandma in the country goes to an elite school where everyone has had serious training. Wow, that would make for a good story about bullying or something right? Wrong. Instead everyone immediately loves her, and those that don't are only heard whispering about her every once in awhile. Story focuses on her incredibly quick and intimate relationship with a bunch of guys. Typical harem fare.
CHARACTERS: I get that this was based on areverse harem game, so the lead has very little character development. She's not very likeable at all (and let's not get into her weird eyes). Then there's the guys: I loved them all. Yet all but 2 of them had a whopping one episode devoted to them in which they had to pour out their problems, their adorableness, and of course fall for the main character for some unknown reason. Episode 8 introduced a new character who I found laughable. There was just way too much going on with the characters to really stop and enjoy it. This should have been a full season, not 13 episodes. 


ANIMATION/ART: Watch the OP through to the end: THE BIRDS EXPLODE! All of the doves EXPLODE! Sure, they explode into golden sparkles and music notes but still... they EXPLODE! Other than that? It's done in a very strange style: like a multiply and blur overlay on the whole animation. It's contrasty and dark for most of the show. This seems to be a style that was popular in the late '00s and early '10s, but it really detracts from the show if you let it.


SOUND: I'm a fan of musical anime, but this one just did not stick with me in terms of the music. It's all so blandly bubble gum. Even the "hardcore" characters get sickeningly sweet music. For a school run by top idols they sure pump out a bunch of carbon copy singers.

If you think that this show is nothing but bright, flashy colors, unrealistic situations, and overused romantic cliches, you'd be dead right.
So, why should you watch this show? Why SHOULDN'T you?!
It's utterly ridiculous, and that's what is so great about it. You just have to watch the ending credits to understand. Besides the fact that the art style is absolutely fantastic, seeing about five different guys fall instantly for the female protagonist - in the first few episodes - is just golden. 
The show is basically romantic schlock for teeny girls; utterly harmless and full of fluff, if not eyeroll inducing. Pretty much all ofthe characters are at least somewhat likable, even the grumpy black haired fellow who pretends he's something he's not is somewhat sympathetic.\n\n
Oh, and -spoiler alert- I basically guessed half way that she'd take these dudes and make them into a boyband. And I was 100% right. She did. And it was glorious.

Let me begin by saying this:
I had dismissed this show for being total fujioshi fluff but watched the first episode  one night out of boredom. Much to my surprise, I enjoyed it and watched it all.
If you're looking for something hardcore, thought-provoking and a interesting twist on the music business---nah who are we kidding? UtaPri proudly wears its hat as this: A cute girl comes to music academy and studies music and befriends/falls/works with six hot guys. 
Story: 8
As I said, want something thought-provoking on music? Go read Rolling Stone. This is just based from an otome(gal)game and it shows. Mainly the first eightepisodes introduce our cast  and the last few are how the song at the ED comes together. Oh, you will never ever EVER get rid of that song in your head, despite it's horrible Engrish. Along the way we get a trap teacher, a beach episode(yes at least one Fish has fanservice) a former action star as a teacher and the principal is a former pop idol himself who frequently pops in with words of advice.....or WTFness.


The only thing that comes close to a story is that one of the Fish wants to escape his past as an idol(whom Haruka loved and inspired her to go into music) and debut as his own person. Does Haruka wind up with him in the end? Stay tuned for season two...


Art: 10


There's some seriously pretty animation and character design here. Everything is so candy colored and girly girl.  Though....seriously UtaPri, what's the deal on Haruka's eyes?  Her eyes are piss yellow! 


Sound 10


The music, much to my surprise, is actually a delight, despite the ED song.  The OP is actually performed by Mamoru Miyano, who plays the former idol looking to start over and......it's actually quite good! 


Personally I rather have the Fish perform solo individual songs, as they are mostly LESS cloying then the Fish's songs.


Too bad we didn't hear from the trap teacher though. We even hear from a character that only makes an cameo in the beach episode. And I would've loved to have heard from Wakamoto.


Character: 7


LOL. All of the tropes are there, but let's start with Haruka


Pro: Has a dream to make a song for her idol....which she kind of does anyway in a roundabout way. She's sincere and sweet, but not in a cloying way. It's easy to see why the male cast is enamored of her...music.


Con: She trips(take a drink everytime she does), cries and has beautiful eyes.....the color of pee. Glow in the dark pee. She does all of what airheads do.



Ichinose: tsundere/Emo Justin Timberlake


Pro: He's a great singer and is played by Mamoru Miyano. Hard to believe that the same person who plays Tamaki, Light and muthafuckin' Okiabe is in this.


Con: He's also kind of a dick to Haruka. 


----

Shou: ShotaBait


Pro: One of the few characters I personally liked. And unlike the other boys, his reason for wanting Haruka is to protect her from herself and because he's found someone who knows what fanboying after a person is like *see anime.


Con: He can't sing. He's a cutie....but he can't sing. He's not bad, but he's scores behind the more smoother voices of the other Fish....except Ittoki


----

Ittoki: boy next door


Pro: Out of the cast(and this is my theory), he seems to really love Haruka and wants more with her. I wonder if the anime plans to hook him and her up, but I have a feeling that he'll be friendzoned in favor of Ichi.


Con: He can't sing either, at least not as well as the other fish. Though I've heard that his VA is much better. 


----

Ren: Lady Killer with Swag


Pro: Yeah, he's hot. Also has a rather sad backstory. He, along with Ittoki and Masato, are probaly my favorites to wind up with Haruka. He seems to be rather enchanted with the Piss Yellow Songtress himself, as he tells Ichinose 'She changed me.' 


Bonus points, because he's voiced by Junichi Suwabe.


Con: I hope he gets a new schtick in season two other than all the ladies want Ren while Ren only has his eyes for the 'Little Lamb'. Also, I've heard bardrunks give better pickup lines.


======

Masato: tsundere/Japanese Housewife


Pro: He's the other guy that I believe truly loves Haruka. All because of how he meets her. Also has a nice ass.


Con: Suzumara needs some better songs to show off his voice.


----------

Natsuki: Cloudcuckoolander


Pro: Natsuki is my favorite hands down. He's a goofball who plays violin like Itzak Pearlman but yet wants to become an idol. Why? Dunno. Also, out of all of the cast, he's the best singer in the group. Sorry Miyano fans...


And watch out when Natsuki goes into alterego mode........


Con: Nothing really. XD 


=======


I also liked Tomo, who's Haruka's roomie, that's aspiring to become an idol herself. Too bad this is aimed at women because I would've liked to see her and Haruka work together on a song. And lastly, my second favorite is Cecil whose idenitiy I'll keep secret for now. 


Enjoyment: 7


As I've said, anyone looking for a deeper show......go somewhere else. UtaPri is as deep as that DOKI DOKI song that's at the end of each episode. If the second season's a hit, then perhaps they'll make a third season where the Fish and Haruka are celebrities. Ichinose can give them tips since he was down that road himself.


Is it the best series out there? Hell no. But it is enjoyable, fun and I TRIPLE dare ANYONE who doesn't have a smile on their face throughout the whole season. :)

Well, onto my review for this anime, I really wanted to a review for this anime, I just loved it so much.
But I think I should state how I actually got into this. What revealed the anime to be was a rather funny story. I had been looking for pictures on google for a good red haired guy to use as a character for an RP I was joining. Well, I just happened upon one of Otoya-kun and I had looked up it. I looked up the anime and saw how I knew so many of the voices in it. And so, after watching thefirst episode, I was totally hooked. 


Now, onto the real review.


The story was so...what's the word...umm, mindblowing? Maybe, I can't think up the word. I was so caught up with it that I had ended up watching it in only two days. XD But the story was so interesting and I just couldn't stop. Now that I finished it, I am hyper for the second season and going to go read the manga. Too bad I can't get the games, that would make it even more enjoyable.


The art was so eye-catching, I was truely brought in with it. Though, I do have to admit, it does take a while to get to the two girls look, Haru-chan and Tomo-chan, they had just interesting hair and eye colors that I was a tad disturbed by it at first. But as I continued to watch it I got used to and eventually began to like it. The background is well done and you can tell they did just half-assed, everything was so detailed and clear.


The music was so inviting, it sometimes has a beat you can dance to and the opening/ending/main song '1000% Love', I could just listen to that over and over again. But there were also songs that just felt so peaceful, or sad. You couldn't help but love it all. I also found it rather interesting that they added a few classics, like 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star' and 'Amazing Grace', and they were in English! It was so clear and you could clearly hear the words. I was in tears when I heard 'Amazing Grace', the only time I did cry through out the whole anime. 


The characters are rather interesting. You want to know more as you watch, and you can help but love all of them. And I dont just mean the main boys, I'm talking about everyone. At least the people who showed up more than once (cept Cacil, he just want to see more of him all the time). I enjoyed the personalties that were show-cased and it made it seem real with it. (Though there were times that they made it seem unreal but that's anime for you). There are even characters that I'm sure everyone could connect with, I know I did with this one character ^^


I enjoyed it so much that I watched it within two days of finding it. I even got my friend into it when I first found it. She still has yet to watch it but I'm sure she'll love it. I am very tempted to watch it over again I enjoyed it so much. But that may have to wait, since I do have school to focus on too XD Being an Otaku and a student is hard.


Overall, I give it a huge 10, I would give it more if I could XD I'm sure anyone who loves music as well as large amount of cute guys would enjoy this. I hope this review helped others to enjoy this anime just as much as I did.

If you've ever watched reverse harem anime, you know that it  usually involves a plain, clueless girl surrounded by a bunch of attractive guys (ranging from "cute" to "hot") who all fall for her / fawn over her for seemingly no reason whatsoever. The story then consists of the girl interacting with each one of the guys and learning a bit about their backstories before feeling "conflicted" and deciding to fall for the guy who is the most mysterious and tsundere of all (aka a jerk). However, even her weak effort at choosing a single guy usually offers little resolution, romance, or satisfaction, forby the time she comes to terms with her "feelings" it's usually time to wrap up the show and you're left guessing about the rest.


Uta no Prince-Sama follows this exact same format with the addition of the themes of idols, composers and music. Since something similar has already been done before with Kiniro no Corda, the writers seem to have tried to throw in some plot twists and other "mysteries", but unfortunately, as with most reverse harems, these are pretty predictable and hardly surprising. 


Nevertheless, this show is far from being terrible or completely unenjoyable. In the reverse harem spectrum it's definitely somewhere in the middle, for it is neither a masterpiece like "Ouran Koukou Host Club" nor a complete abomination like "Diabolik Lovers". Rather, it stays in the mediocre-but-almost-good comfort zone with the likes of Kiniro no Corda, Fruits Basket, Vampire Knight, Bonjour Koiaji Pâtisserie, and many others. 


Although the art is certainly much nicer than in the modern classics mentioned above, the animation could have used some improvement. Scenes involving singing and dancing often appear awkward or disjointed and would have greatly benefitted from more frames or even a little CGI. Additionally, the protagonist's eyes are a bit unattractive and disturbing to look at (although this is probably a matter of personal taste). 


The music is perhaps one of the strongest points in this series, for it is fitting and enjoyable. While nothing out of this world, Mamoru Miyano does a great job at singing the opening as well as some other songs, and overall the seiyuus' work really shines. 


Besides most seiyuus in this anime being well-known and award-winning, it was also refreshing to see (or hear) them do something different. Although I could tell that Mamoru Miyano would be in this series from the first episode, I actually had trouble identifying his character because he did not use the usual sugary sweet voice I've become accustomed to hearing in most eye-candy series in which he is featured. Additionally, Nakamura Yuuichi also voices a character that is completely different from his usual work, hence making things all the more interesting. 


It is mainly thanks to the great performances from the voice actors as well as the lovely art from the animators that I was able to enjoy this series (which would have otherwise been an extremely generic reverse harem).


If you're a fan of (or are at least familiar with) this genre of anime and know what you're getting into, then this can definitely be an entertaining little show. If you have no interest in a bunch of mini-romances with generic subplots as well as pretty art and bubbly Jpop music, then you would probably be best advised to skip this.

Uta Pri has pretty visuals, a fair cast and somewhat catchy the music. The question is would you watch it? Well, for any fan of music and for most girls/women that like nice eye candy, I'd say yes! 
I admit I am a sucker for reverse harems, but I am interested to see whether the plot of the series makes it out to be even more worthwhile or just another pretty show. I have mixed emotions about the plot because of the main character, Haruka Nanami. Sure, she is innocent and hardworking, and that's great; however, the truth of the matter is that in areal-life scenario, our lovely Nanami would not even get into such a prestigious school. 


That aside, throughout the series you do get to see each of the prospective idols interact with her and you get to know them individually. Of course for any girl who's to say you can't love them all!? The guys were handsome in their own ways and you see their specific talents, along with small, rural town Nanami growing into a more confident and musical young lady.  The animation is detailed and the colors are crisp and unique, which was another draw-in factor, but not the main one.


When it comes to the quality of music, I'd say it's just slightly above average. The songs are catchy and fun. Some characters (or actual voice actors) try hard to sing well. I can hear strain and some inconsistency with this. Some shine more than others though. 


The enjoyment factor is above average as well. The voice acting really pushes through, though as mentioned earlier, plot and character value are those weaknesses. Since this series has a second arc, I will be continuing to see what develops as our potential idols shoot for the stars!
