Решил глянуть, хоть и седзе, но на своем опыте знаю, что некоторое можно и парням смотреть без вреда своей психике.
Соглашусь с комментом выше - картинкаслишком ядовита, аж глаза режет, и глаза у героини неживые, как будто она слепая - не покидала меня мысль на протяжении просмотра всей серии. Сюжет по ходу типичен, а персонажи заштампованные, зато подача юмора мне понравилась. О да! Директор жжжетт! )))

Those wondering why I gave it a middle score, even though all you are going to see is me mostly complaining, is because it's pretty similar to most otome games turned anime shows. Plus I normally use these as a way to find new otome games that may peak my interest compared to a actual anime to watch on its own.
OK, so first things first... OMG THE FEMALE CHARACTER!!  I understand this whole "lets make the main female as bland and submissive as possible" so people can think of them self's as that character, but oml save me please. Just throw her and theno-name girl from amnesia in a room together, they have so much in common they'd be BFFL's. What would of made it better even though it wouldn't have happened would be if they made her red headed friend the main character instead, she had more going for her, like a personality and multiple emotions.


She basically has no personality apart from being kind and liking music but only knows how to play the piano but is somehow one hell of a composure?

Somehow all these guy fall in love with her so quickly for the simplest of reasons it's as if they've never had a girl look in their direction before, then this country punkin pops out of no where and their brain just completely go south basically... 


I understand that it is not many episodes so the romance will be rushed, along with the fact that it was a game, so most of time in such cases it gets left out in favour to keep it in the game and not spoiling the routes but this can lead to lack of development and plot.


The dudes were nice but cliche, clearly one of those pick you favourite husbando from these stereotypical looking and personality boys! Oh look a flirtatious guy, oohh look he plays the saxophone, who would've guessed? Sometimes a bit of cliche/stereotyping is nice, but not when it's the only thing really going for them.


conclusion: basically a make your own fantasy "I'm a composer surrounded by good looking guys a reality"

Mostly fan service, some singing and music.

THE MUSIC IS ACTUALLY REALLY GOOD ALL CONSIDERED AND IS WASTED ON THIS.

Art style is pretty...

I honestly don't understand why this series gets so much hate.
Honestly, I can see why people giving this horrible reviews, I don't care for this season too much myself. However, I still think you should give it a shot.
Story: 6
This is the least exciting season of the series, and the lowest scoring section in this review. Yes, there is a conflict, but it doesn't make for a dramatic story. Also, most of the season has what I call "focus episodes," meaning there are episodes dedicated to concentration on one particular character and Nanami's interactions with them. Some of these are good episodes, others are abit lacking but do have funny gag reels. Yet once we get past these episodes, you're already more than halfway through the series and its a bit of a scramble to make it to the finish line. Despite that, its not that bad, and the last 2 or 3 episodes are a pretty good wrap-up of the pilot season.


Art: 10

With the exception of Nanami's eyes, I love the character art. Sure, once in a while a shot will be a bit off-model, but everyone is very well drawn. The background art is amazing. It's got enough detail to really transport you into their world without being overbearing. Even the lighting is perfect. The studio did a fantastic job in that department.

Also: I love the opening song animation.


Sound: 10

I LOVE THE MUSIC!!! I have a playlist of every song that has ever come from this series (including the video games, drama CDs, etc.) and it makes me happy when I've had a sucky day. Sure, one or two of them aren't my favorites, but they're enough to bring you a sense of each guy's style. The background music is good too; it sets the mood nicely. Also, the opening song is pretty fantastic. Mamoru Miyano has a great voice.


Character: 7

Also one of the lower scoring sections. I didn't care for the personalities of certain people until season 2. Nanami is a bit helpless at first (although I don't 100% blame her for it), and I could not stand Ren or Tokiya for a while (the former being an overbearing flirt and way too passive and sarcastic, and the later was rude and a bit too stoic for my taste). Shining Saotome freaked me out (and still does), and everyone else felt like they were missing something. Don't let that stop you; there's this lovely thing called character development and that helps a lot.


Enjoyment: 8

I like this series, but sometimes the series felt a bit slow.

And it was (see "Story"), but there were plenty of things to enjoy. There are plenty of funny bits here and there, and I enjoyed listening to the music. The focus episodes varied on how much I enjoyed them depending on who it was (*cough*Ren&Tokiya*cough*), and the rest was "meh," but I still had fun with it.


Overall: 9

This series has its ups and downs, and if you've seen any other reverse harem, you'll know they're all like that. This is a series started with a simple PSP game 6 years ago and is now one of the most popular reverse-harem series in Japan (their most recent live event was in the Super Saitama Arena, which seats 36,500 and was to capacity that night). If you like music, a full spectrum of cute/hot guys with various personalities, this is certainly something for you.

At first it may seem like it's set almost like a dating sim game, but actually there's more to it. The minute I watched the first episode, I was already hooked in. The main pointer I have though, is the art style of the anime. When it switches to the more vivid colours, it looks to bright. Maybe I'm being a bit too picky, but I generally feel like it just too bright. Of course, I understand that this is just the individual style of the publisher, but i feel like it could have been toned down a bit. Also, the opening is rather catchy,and has an impact from the start. None the less, i like the art style of the anime, it's unique in it's own way. On the other, it wins with it's humour, as from the very first episode you can expect to have a laugh. I can defiantly say that I was having a laugh, just half way through the first episode. Therefore, if you want something a bit different, and something that includes music, and will make you laugh then, have a go watching Uta no Prince-same.

First off let me say how much I enjoyed watching this. The music is just so catchy that I had to download it for myself and I have it consistently playing on repeat and can never get bored with it. There is some romance in the show since there are one girl and many many boys, but it goes through how she helps them get famous and bring out their true potential.
The storyline wasn't the best but it is worth watching if you have watched this I advise you to watch the second one, I have yet to watch the third but at some point,i plan to.

I really enjoyed this anime but the heroine really ruined it for me, that girl is just so fucking annoying it's unbelievable how irritating she is. She's so weak, innocent (in an ignorant, annoying way) and just a real crybaby.
Besides her, I found the other characters really lovely and enjoyable because along with them being funny, mostly clever, charming and cool they showed some real character development throughout the anime which was really nice to be a part of as a viewer.
Overall, I recommend it as one of those animes you watch to get in a better mood - it's lighthearted and sweet, as longas you don't expect it to be some brilliant story and you just roll with it, it's a pretty enjoyable way to pass your time. Just keep in mind that the heroine is a real pain.

(I'm shit at writing reviews so read this at your own risk XD)
Okay, my first thought about this show:
SO CHEESY.
I first heard about this from Youtube, off an AMV actually. Basically I saw the bishies and thought “OHHHH LOOKS GOOD!” and then looked it up MAL. And you know what MAL put in it’s description?
You don't? Look at the top of this page and see for yourself. //me reads and cringes in horror.
That description totally put me off the show however I still went and got myself a copy of the episodes out so far and figured I could trudge through it slowly when Ihad time since the art looked shiny and pretty[definitely AMV material] but what I was not expecting was that I’d actually enjoy it. Now let’s get reviewing.


Story: 7/10


While not entirely new, it’s certainly refreshing. As with most shoujo animes, it’s in a highschool setting. But it’s no ordinary highschool. It’s a school for LEARNING MUSIC! Mainly for idols and composers who write songs for those idols. Now that’s where the bishies come in, I mean you can’t really be an idol unless you’re pleasing to the eye to some extent right? So yush, I’m loving the bishies. Especially Shou, dammit he’s just too cute! He’s like one of those little puppies or soft plushies you just wanna hug and squish to death. Uh yeah now I’m going off track. *cough* Anyway that’s not to say this show doesn’t have it’s negatives, for starters the pacing is completely weird and I’m not just talking about the last episode[13]. I just felt like the entire show's time space was just screwed up. For the most part I had no idea why and what was happening because it was just thrust into our faces(eg. the beach vacation for finding your partner shiz) And since I just finished Ep13, let's add a summary for that. IT'S NOT EVEN SPOILERISH SINCE IT'S SO PREDICTABLE. Really, I was sitting there literally waiting for things to happen because I already knew what was gonna happen. o__o


[EP13 SUMMARY]


Firstly she’s all shocked that the Headmaster doesn’t approve of her, then when everyone is backing her up she tells them to STFU and get on with their debut while being cool beans about everything, then she runs off from the school and to her grandma’s place acting all depressed, Mrs Grandma being the awesome Grandma she is lends her a shoulder to cry on and to help her get over her depressingness and OMG GUESS WHAT, the hot guys come to her Grandma’s place and sings her a song to cheer her up and then the Headmaster pops up in the countryside too!


Say, how much weirder can an episode get? Not to mention lame. Really. I was very confuddled. I wasn’t even hesitant about including the plot for episode 13 in this review because it’s completely predictable and anyone who complains about it being spoilerific should be shot.


Also with the exception of Tokiya, everyone was SO friendly with her at first sight. Whatever happened to relationship building over time HUH?! NO PAIN NO GAIN REMEMBER!


Let's not forget the cheesiness.....it's really cheesy.


Art: 10/10


Oh it’s so shiny and pretty. *__* So sparkly and glowy. Excellent AMV material and eye candy. And I mean it has bishies, HOW GOOD CAN IT GET?


Sound: 8/10


I liked a few of the songs, mainly the ending. The other ones just felt totally lame but it does express their emotions well in each part of the story.


Characters: 9/10


Everyone was likeable minus the Headmaster. Yes even Haruka and her very annoying “Oh…I’m not as good as you guys” and very “airhead-like” attitude. The guys all have unique personalities and unique background stories which makes them very interesting that helps leave an impression on viewers. The Headmaster while being interesting in his own way just pissed me off for the entire show with his annoying speech and his crappy way of assessing people. What a loser.


Overall: 9/10


I started watching for the bishies and actually surprised myself with how much I liked this show in general. Because minus some of the extremely cheesy lines and lame singing/dancing parts, this show was pretty enjoyable to watch

Story: With dreams of becoming a composer and someday writing a song for her favorite idol, Haruka enters the Saotome Academy, a prestigious performing arts school. If successful there, she’ll be able to join the Shining Agency after graduation. However, it won’t be so easy when Haruka is already surrounded by potential idols and composers. On top of that, her homeroom teacher is a current idol, the headmaster was a record-breaking singer, and the academy itself is a chaotic place where anything can happen. Which prince of song will be paired up with Haruka?! 
Source: www.animefreak.tv
About the story, if you hate dramatic anime, I wouldnot recommend this anime. The story moves on very slowly and believe me, the main character (Nanami Haruka) will start annoying you at some point. As I already said about the story, it's a good story and fun to watch but it moves on very slowly. You will have to be very patient watching this anime.


About the art, I have to say, I think the producers did a terrific job. It was very well drawn and the colours were really bright. Although I think they could have used a little less sparkles.


The sound is also of a very good quality, but there's not always the right soundtrack at the right moment. During normal conversations, they put on a very dramatic soundtrack. This anime is one big drama.


The characters are sort of realistic. Nanami Haruka, the protagonist really started annoying me. When I mean annoying, I mean she was crying for no reason at all. I did really enjoy the male characters. But all their conversations were with Nanami Haruka, that sort of ruined it.


I definitely enjoyed the anime, and I am looking forward to season 2. They will also bring in new male characters in the new season. If I'm correct, it will air somewhere in April 2013.


Overall, I recommend this anime. I enjoyed this so much that I even rewatched it ( which I don't do very often!) Please watch this anime!!


Thank you for reading!

This anime anime will be a hit or miss, youll either love it or hate it. I'm into the reverse harem, romance, music anime stuff, so I love it. Some people may find it cheesy or stupid, but it all depends on what kind of anime you like.
If you like La Corda d'Oro or Yumerio Patissiere, or Aikatsu! or even Full Moon, I think you will like this one.
Ja

I'm not sure if it's because I haven't seen any other reverse harems (except OHSHC) or because of the fact that I love cute boys that sing and dance to cliche'd pop music (hello, One Direction), but I enjoyed the hell out of this series. Now, by all means, it's definitely not a masterpiece, and nowhere near original, but for what it is, it's entertaining.
Speaking of originality, there is next to none when it comes to, well, everything. The story (which gets a 5, by the way) takes place in a school devoted to training singers and composers, with six boys and one girl tochoose which one she wishes to do the most. Although, she never really does choose, does she? In fact, it sets itself up as a harem, but really, it's more about friendship, and doesn't go beyond some 'sincere' words and a whole lot of blushing. That's fine and all, but the romance is... nonexistent. So if your looking for that, you won't find here.


Now, if I had the emotionless personality and the satanic looking eyes like her, guys would be lining up for me in no time, according to this. And they would be some of the most stereotypical guys, too. The main character, as said before, has no personality to speak of, but she still has that "special something," which, I guess?, is composing music. Her roommate is the stereotypical friend, but doesn't really do much and is so irrelevant, I forgot her name. The boys range from emotionless to the too-friendly to the playa boy archetypes. The only guy really worth mentioning is the one with glasses for reasons that would go into spoiler territory. The characters get a 7 because they played their stereotypes well and felt like they had a connection. They also sang good together. And were pretty bang-able. Moving on!


The music isn't really anything special, except the end song, which I found myself singing along to so loud that my mom had to come into my room and tell me to shut up. I can't help it, I really like cliche'd pop music, especially j-pop with engrish mixed in. It's a weakness, I know. The opening was skip-worthy and nothing else really popped. So, 7 again.


The art (6) was alright. The character designs were great for the guys (they were hot, what can I say). The main character, who really should invest in regular colored contacts, or take out the ones she currently wearing, looked average aside from those eyes.


Call this a guilty pleasure, if you will, because my overall enjoyment was a 9. However, looking at it from a reviewers perspective, like I am, the characters and story were unoriginal, the sound wasn't anything amazing and the art was average. It was good for what it was, and exceeded my exceptions (because they were unbelievable low). It is an anime worth watching if you're bored one day and don't have anything else to watch. Or, sexy boys could be your thing, in which case watch this, and watch it now.


Final Verdict: satanic eyes + sexy guys = hot sex (see what I did there?)

Believe it or not, I didn't start watching this show because of the reverse harem aspect - although that is something I have no objections to ;). The reason I started watching this is because I've always been fascinated by the music industry in Japan - especially by the concept of whole schools made for mass-producing boybands for teenage girls like myself to drool over. Being a successful musician only partially involves being good at singing - there's dancing, character, style, almost a new personality you have to adopt to be an idol of the public.
Anyway, so yes I watched this because I was interestedin the manufacturing process behind jpop bands, but I'll get on to reviewing the damn thing now. Before I say anything else though, I will say that if you're a straight guy, you should really turn tail and run because you will gain absolutely nothing from watching Utapri.


Story - 7

Although I really liked the setting, there was quite a lot of angsting to be done. I could tell that it didn't have an amazing or overly intellectual plot while I was watching it. I know for a fact that it won't win any prizes for screenwriting. But, for once, I found that I didn't actually care that much. It was so much fun to watch, the somewhat underdeveloped story didn't matter at all.


Art - 8

Lots of flowery, sparkly, shiny, starry shoujo goodness. Need more be said? If you wanna make a reverse harem, you wanna make sure that those guys are damn fine looking. There's nothing worse than a harem filled with ugly creatures! Utapri has most certainly ticked that box.


Sound - 10

Here's where I start to really, really, really like Utapri... I'm listening to the soundtrack now, and I will be for a long, long time. It is perhaps - no, certainly - the catchiest damn anime soundtrack ever. It's an anime ALL ABOUT MAKING CATCHY SONGS. And catchy songs it has. Better than some actual jpop groups. Every guy gets their own song, and they're all pretty talented. If you don't believe me, just look up the main Maji Love 1000% song.


Character - 9

Usually the failing of harems is to drop down into stereotypes. Although there are some hints of those in the characters, they are only vague, and all the characters get about an episode or so of development (which is a lot for something only 13 eps long). Haruka is quite emotive, but not in a way that makes her annoying - emotive in a way that makes the audience feel sympathy and emote right along with her.

Furthermore, the guys are all *cough* very attractive. With *cough* attractive qualities. I like all of them so much that I don't want to see Haruka reject them! They have some quite unique personalities that you wouldn't see in another harem. Schizophrenia is a quality I never expected to see in a romane interest like that.

But even though all the guys get some good character development, Tokiya is the clear stand-out. Much of the plot revolves around his past and struggles. I would bet good money that Haruka will choose him eventually. (And I don't blame her just look at him honestly)


Enjoyment - 9

It's difficult for a harem that takes itself seriously not to feel awkward and forced. (I'm looking at you, Kanigami no Asobi). But Utapri does this very successfully. There's so much fun to be had watching it, from drooling, to singing along with the songs, to laughing at the hijinks, to shouting at the screen 'GODDAMN ICHINOSE JUST KISS HER ALREADY'. Really I just loved every second I spent watching it.


Overall - 9

Uta no Prince Sama is an absolute blast to watch. There's a kind of enjoyment that only a harem can create. So far on my list, Utapri is second only in its genre to Ouran.

I really enjoyed this anime! It stuck to it's plot and had it's moments, and the design is all really good! At first I didn't understand why Haruka had gold eyes but then thinking about it again, this anime was originally an otome game, and what main girl in otome games don't have 'different' colored eyes?
Story ~ It was actually really enjoyable. I found this anime through an AMV, and as soon as I saw it I knew I would enjoy it. It stuck to the plot and Haruka got to fulfill her dream.
Art ~ It was very bright, and vibrant. The designs were great,and every second of the anime was filled with a 'happy' feeling that made your lips kinda turn into a smile at some point. \n
Sound ~ Well it's called Uta no Prince-sama for a reason, right? The music and voice actors were perfect for this anime, and every song was bright, loud and fun. \n
Characters ~ I loved them! The way they all grew together and focused on the same dream was great, and they were developed well too. They all had their ups and downs but all was resolved by the end of it. I hated how Haruka didn't get together with one of them, but I guess it would be unfair since there are SIX GUYS WHO HAVE FALLEN FOR HER!+ A cat but let's not go there...\n
Overall, I really liked this anime, though there might be some who disagree this is my review and this is how I saw it.

Good music, and a pleasant, light-hearted feeling.
Utapri's story line really has nothing special to it. In a way, it's a stereotypical reverse harem where a girl is thrown into a situation where she is somehow surrounded by a group of cute guys. In this case, it's some sort of top class music school that, not so surprisingly, is a boarding school as well. Can't say that something similar hasn't been done before. On the other hand, though the idea is on the unoriginal side, the feeling of it is very unique to me. I find that many reverse harem anime's tend to be filled tothe brim with drama and plot-twists, while this one was simply fluffy, happy, and dreamy, throwing some tiny, intense moments in as well just to drawl the viewer in a bit more, but overall, it had a very nice, light feeling to it which I thoroughly enjoyed.


The art was above average, but not something I feel to be gawk worthy. Haruka's eyes are a complete hiccup in my opinion, not only are they big and soulless, but then they turned around and colored them some ghastly yellow. They give off creepy vibes here and there, not pleasant,considering it messes with her sweet and kind character. Aside from that though, I felt everything else meshed well and was very fitting. 


To be honest, sound and characters were the major selling points of this anime for me. The sound is fantastic! But I mean, you can't expect anything less from a musical related show. If you're gonna base an anime on music, do it right, and I felt the anime was spot on with it. As for the characters, I felt everyone was very unique. They all had their own niche, and they played them well, which I really liked. I kinda wish it had gone more in depth with each character.....but I can imagine that being kinda difficult to do with all six guys in only 13 episodes.I'm hoping the sequel will shed some more light onto them, but I still liked and enjoyed them, so I guess that's what mainly counts. 


Anyone who enjoys music, and wants a show with a more low-key vibe to it, I feel this will be a good match-up. Also, there's some good bishounens in there as well, for those who are interested~ ;P It's definitely worth giving a try at the very least c:

Ok, Uta no Prince Sama gets a lot of hate. I will admit it looks a whole lot like a reverse harem anime, and at some points it even begins to feel like one, but if that's all you see in it then you're missing the point completely. Uta no Price Sama is about 7 teens chasing their dreams in today's harsh world of record deals and mega-hits. It's about how the people who make music really captivate souls and create dreams. And in the end, it nails exactly what it was trying for. And for that reason, it is one of my all timefavorite anime. But hey~ cute guys and great music helps a little too :)


Story: Well, I'm not going to lie, Uta no Prince Sama gets off track sometimes. They spend a bit too much time explaining the characters then I would've liked, but it turned out to be a bit necessary to the plot, so that's ok I guess. I think the side plots, no matter how useless at times, give the show part of it's charm. In the middle of the show, it starts to feel like it's going nowhere for a mere millisecond, but suddenly by the last few episodes everything clicks into place and the plot is heartbeat by heartbeat perfection. Looking at it all together, the plot managed to take this show in the right direction and managed not to be cheesy, though at times it was evident that plot was the weak point of the show. But it had it's moments, and was all ok in the end, so I give plot an 8/10



Art: The art was absolutely gorgeous! The character designs perfectly accented their personalities, and the backgrounds and scenery were pretty too. They were not at all lazy with the background characters and such, absolutely everything was pretty. I feel like if the art was any different, the show would lose some of it's appeal. It just wouldn't be the same. That's saying a lot. And don't think I'm just saying this cuz I only watched it because of the hot guys XD 10/10


Sound: I came into the show half expecting all of the music to be sub-par the actual content, I mean it's an anime, it's not like they're going to spend all the time writing songs, right? But the music surprised me by being heartfelt and catchy, music that doesn't even just supplement the show fantastically, even define it to some extent (which it does), it's even music I would like to have on my iPod. 

The voice actors were fantastic. I usually watch my anime dubbed, but the sub was so great that I couldn't even imagine it in English, especially the singing and the character's music.

THE SINGING! All of the voice actors had great singing voices.

I was overall impressed and delighted with the sound. 10/10


Character: The characters are really the core of the show, more than anything else. They may seem a bit half baked and stereotypical at a glance, but they are all very complex and realistic. I promise! They have great background and are much more than to what meets the eye, while still keeping you interested. They characters are really truly wonderful overall. 10/10  


Enjoyment: I was basically a floating happy cloud of rainbow whilst watching this anime. It is always enjoyable, even for someone like me who is bored easily. I almost never took my eyes off the screen, and yes, I do admit to jumping around and dancing to the songs. But you will too, no matter how much you think you will hate it. It hit all the right notes. (bad pun huehuehue)  10/10


Overall, I can sum up Uta no Prince Sama in one scene, from the last episode: (very minor spoilers)


All of the boys hi five Haruka on the way out to the stage, with huge smiles on their faces. Haruka looks on proundly, eyes glistening as they go out. They dance and sing their hearts out with more passion than you could imagine.


In the end, Uta no Prince Sama is amazing show about living your dreams and spreading cheer through the magic of music, And no matter how dumb that sounds, you'll want to hive Haruka anyways and sing your heart out with some hot bishies. What could possibly go wrong tonight?


Overall 9/10

There are many otome game anime, but this one takes the cake for the best. Of course, if the all out zany-ness of it is something you fancy. Its one of those "so bad its good" sort of deal.
While there are cute moments with our female lead, she is definitely flat and boring. On a side note, she looks kinda blind, even though she can see perfectly fine. Who applies to a musical academy when /you can't read sheet music/???
What really makes this show enjoyable is how much importance they put on pop music. It literally can make people kneel in awe or explode withpleasure. Some things that are readily accepted even though they are super strange. Our male love interests are fun and honestly, that's what you came here for right?\n\n
Other than the catchy theme song Maji 100% Love, the music is... difficult to enjoy for me. The artwork though is very pretty, the way they color and shade the characters is very lovely.

My anime first review, but I feel like enough hasn't been said about certain aspects of the anime and the polarizing "don't watch" or "amazing" reviews don't really help.
Essentially: it's Diabolik Lovers but with an actual plot. And there's a lot less aggression, possessiveness, and sadism. Characters are actually likable rather than being just fanservice. 
If me saying "Diabolik Lovers" hasn't warded you off yet (I despised DL but went onto season DL More Blood for the hot guys obvi), I suggest giving it a try. I mean it IS an otome turned anime so it's as much as you'll expect out of it. 
Tobe honest, if you're looking at the review page, chances are you're already leaning towards not watching it cuz you probably want a deep or revolutionary anime worth your time.\n\n
The demographic of this anime is essentially shallow and vain people who just wanna watch hot anime men act in various romantic scenes with music and singing (i.e. me).  But, it is a FAIR and DECENT anime.

I can't really say that i enjoyed it. It could have been a lot better.
Characters: First of all, the main character. She was kind of pathetic. How can someone, who can't read music at fist be so good at it? She is over sensitive, thinks that she is the most important, know-it-all person. Plus the other 6 dudes, what was up with them? Syo should just throw his hats away, plus the red head had an annoying voice. I'm sure not all of them can sing. 
Story: I can say that was kind of heartwarming story. Some stuff did not make any sense to meat all. Like the first episodes first few minutes. Haruka was late but so was the red headed dude, but he was let to go to the exam right away. How??? Why?? Besides how could Haruka grow so important to them in so short time? Just doesnt make sense at all.

I wanted to like this so much more than I did.  The voice cast is godly and superb.  The characters are loveable and fun.  The story, in general, is interesting.  The music is fantastic.
What killed me (and pretty much ruined me on watching beyond this season)... is the heroine.  This will probably sound petty and lame, but who in the hell has orange and green eyes with no whites to them?  I honestly couldn't stand to look at her, it bothered me that much.  Combined with her wishy-washy behavior and attitude, I would have preferred she not bein the anime at all.\n\n
I wanted to watch more of the season because I honestly adore the entire male voice cast, but I just couldn't.  I could barely make it through this one.

I have never been one for harems, but since I discovered reversed harems I love to watch them (and I am not afraid to admit it).
The music in this anime is out of this world. Every song, be it the characters singing or not, is beautiful. The lyrics are well-written and really express the feelings of the music.
I was a minor fan of jpop before this anime, but now, I constantly have the songs on repeat!
The environments are beautiful and the animation doesn't fall short in the entire series. Overall, light colours are used, making it easy on the eyes.
Whenever there's a song, the animationmakes it extra beautiful by giving more feel to it.\n
All in all, a good job.\n\n
Uta no Prince-sama is, in my opinion, a must-watch if you like reversed harems and/or jpop. The music, story and overall look is good and enjoyable. Music lovers will definitly enjoy this.\n
However, if you are not into harem, you might want to skip this one.

Uta no Prince-sama was extremely frustrating to watch. The plot was ridiculous and over dramatic, and the characters were extremely emo. The characters reacted to things that honestly were not even that big of a deal, and the worst part was that the ending dragged on.
But let me tell you how adorable the characters were. Haruka, the main character, was a kind fucking ray of sunshine. The boys were also really fun characters, and their interactions with each other were great as well. The singing and music was average, but the ending song was great.
I suck at writing reviews gomen.

I guess you could say Uta no Prince Sama is so bad that it is actually good. I'm not sure how else to describe this show.
Story 6/10: The show is kind of cliché, a bunch of people try to get into the music school so they can become superstars or something along those lines. But it is different because they managed to toss in some kind of magical element. I won't really get into the magic thing, you will just have to see for yourself.
Art 4/10: Oh my gosh, everybody has said it already but I'm going to say it again: the main girl hassome seriously freaky eyes. Her eyes look like they belong in some horror anime rather than in a romance anime! They have like some, weird film over them or something. Also, maybe I am not a fashionable person but I think the school uniforms are pretty ugly. I mean you got stripes and plaid and nothing really matches. It is just a lot to look at.


Sound 8/10: Now since this show is all about music, how does it stack up? I think the show was pretty good in this department. Most of the songs are pretty enjoyable. I really love the opening Orpheus Heart but the ending song is really annoying. But even if you hate the ending song it is still kind of catchy. They have a lot of other songs too that the characters sing in the show. So at least you won't be bored.


Character 7/10: To sum up, Haruka is a stalker. She came to the school because of....wait for it....yup, some guy. You have some really happy characters and some dark/antisocial/brooding characters, that creep with the saxophone, and that crazy guy with the glasses. Oh yeah, and the headmaster is kind of a stalker too. The show tries to give the characters some depth by providing some backstory and struggles, but all of that kind of goes out the window when all of them start freaking out on the dance floor. I mean, the dance scenes are pretty hilarious.


Enjoyment 10/10: Despite it's many flaws, I really enjoyed this show. It was funny, probably not in the way it was supposed to be, but that doesn't really matter, if it manages to make you smile. Like this :D!


Overall 7/10: Do NOT take this show seriously, it's supposed to be fun and ridiculous. In fact have fun with it while your watching, try and see if you could do the dances or sing along with the songs! Oh and if you hate it; make fun of it! Either way it's a win win situation!

Overall it's a good anime to kill time, but it's not one that I would get attached to.
Characters: 7
All the guys have unique personalities and are very likable. However, I don't like the female lead. She's not unique enough for reverse harem. I personally like strong spirited female leads, such as Kajika (from another anime). Kajika is strong willed, outgoing and cheers the others up. She's not "the typical girl" out there. Haruka is the one who needs cheering up and is rather shy. If anything, Tomochika, Haruka's friend, should be the main lead.
Music: 7
Not as good as I thought. There's a couple in herethat have unique, memorable melodies, but not good enough for an anime focusing on music. I know a lot of anime out there that have way better music, the kind of music that captivates me on the spot, ones that I listen to over and over. Those anime don't even focus on music.\n
Art: 8\n
The art I admit is pretty good. It's just Haruka's eyes that creep me out. I mean, no one has yellow iris and a green pupil.\n
Story: 7\n
The plot is different and there's very few set in a music school, but then again there aren't many reverse harems...\n
Enjoyment: 6\n
It did kill some time and it wasn't super boring, so I give it a 6.

This anime was a really fun anime to watch. I loved how the character were all developed and the plot was pretty cool. You can't find a lot of these kinds of anime where it's all just about music. The main character was not my favorite. I'm picky about the heroine. The music was fantastic! They even did music videos! Overall I really enjoyed this anime and hope to see a second season or another anime like this. ^_^

Need to refill your cute-boy stash ? Want to have nosebleeds just thinking about all that yaoi probably happening behind the scenes ? Well then , you must watch Uta no Prince-sama.
The story isn't anything special , it's quite cliche actually , but it's stunning art , lovable characters and sweet songs definitely make up for that. 
We've seen so many animes/movies and read so many books with a group of boys fighting over a girl , but nothing quite like this . What makes UtaPri unique is , of course , it's characters . The boys are each different , and there's something forevery type of girl (or boy ) to love.  


I'm not an expert in art ,so there's not much I can say about the art. I'm sure it won't give you an eye-sore though ;)


Now , I'm a musician , so I can judge the music : At first , you'd think it's nothing special , just boy-band cr*p , so rockers or rappers wouldn't seem to interested . But after you've listened to the songs a few times , you will realize how much work the voice-actors put into it . I don't know about all the other people who watched this , but I have all of their songs on my iPod , and listening to one of them , just makes me happy. The songs are pretty good , and the voices are incredible . 


Now , to the characters. As I said , there's something for each girl/boy to love. Just not Otoya . He's mine. 


Enjoyment : I'm giving this one a ten. Time flew while I was watching this ,and I forgot all about the cold weather or the annoying teachers . 


If you love yaoi , this anime is totally worth a watch . It's full of yaoi potential , and I will not give up hope that some of the guys will end up with each other, but that isn't the point . If you don't love yaoi , it's okay , you should still watch it . That was all from me . Hope you found my review helpful .

Story: 10/10

Their voices arenot always totally in sync, and suit the characters very well. The music is awesome. (It's a musical, get over it. :P)\n\n

I SWEAR, IT'S JUST THAT ONE GIRL, WHO JUST HAD TO RUIN EVERYTHING. Her eyes are scary... I mean, everything is absolutely adorable about her! But since no one noticed that she's annoying, they all think she's 'wonderful'. Someone kill me, and kill me now. No, wait. Kill her. To be honest, it's just her. She's scared of haunted house, enjoys composing, KEEPS getting lost, is a certified damsel in distress, cries too much, and keeps saying : "I'm so happy to hear that!" "I'm so glad!" For every reverse harem lover, congratulations, you've reached paradise. \n\n

I liked it a lot, except-say it with me now, THAT ONE GIRL. It would've gotten more, but it's just...ready for it... THAT ONE GIRL. \n

FIRST: Do not watch if you A. HATE reverse harem B. Dislike music 
Second: I truly enjoyed and loved this anime, and I've seen A LOT of romance anime. I really enjoyed the music and the stories behind each of the characters. 
If you like romance anime, music and reverse anime, you will REALLY enjoy this! I cannot wait for the second season! :D

STORY: typically when I come across a series such as this, I expect it to be about the importance of transmitting emotions through music. The story was interesting and after each episode, I kept wanting more. It is focused on a shy girl named Nanami. She is very nervous upon entering the music academy. She meets who she thinks is Hayato, but the boy says that he is his twin brother (Ichinose Tokiya). When moments such as this happen, the viewer can pretty much predict what is going to happen next. Nanami explores music with her new friends and create a new music group. Ithink that viewers will be able to connect to this story and will definitely be sucked in. 


ART: When I pick an anime to watch, I always check the art first. Uta no Prince-Sama did not let me down. It was great to watch and I was never bored. Very detailed. Got my fangirl feels on. Twas a great night


SOUND: Loved the music, instantly downloaded it on my iPod. Whenever Tokiya popped up on my screen or his voice in the songs on my iPod, I would start giggling like a crazed fangirl. Thank god no one is here watching me.


CHARACTER: ICHINOSE TOKIYA. NEED I SAY MORE?


ENJOYMENT: great art, great music, great character development, reverse harem? Hell yeah I enjoyed it.


OVERALL: Hmmm...Let's see. I liked the music, the art and the story. There were a lot of HOT guys that can sing. I'm giving this a 10

Ok so if you are looking sceptically at this anime I am sure you are not alone and I can assure you that I was in two minds about watching it myself. This anime is not for everyone it is incredibly cheesy there is a lot of music is the meaning of life and music is what makes the world go round type stuff in here and I didn't really like that yet I still give the story a 7 because for some reason I couldn't stop watching, I guess it's the romantic and comedic elements that I enjoyed. I found the art to bevey good for the most part which aids in the enjoyment of the series but not that significantly. As it is a musical anime I believe the sound quality had to be good so it didn't detract from the show however it doesn't do much to make the anime more enjoyable. On the whole characterisation was good however Haruka's character did annoy me at times but this was too a minimum. Finally enjoyment and overall experience were good i did dislike the heavy emphasis put on music but it was somehow compensated for by the rest of the story. As I said before it is not for everyone and I can't promise that you will like it if you have seen similar anime but if you can get pt the singing and dancing and quite frankly some very wired plot twists you might enjoy it so give it a try!

So I really like the concept of this series. The storyline is very typical anime, so there isn't any real surprises, but still pleasant to watch. The Art was the best part. Everything scene was drawn beautiful, but at some part, the episode had them flying and confetti of stars, hearts, and circles of all colors exploded everywhere. I found that kind of childish. The story is based on people who want to become composers and singers aka celebrities. So the music was good, but not amazing. I found some of the male leads voice pleasant, but others not so much. The characters all havetheir own distinct personalities, which is a good thing, but the main female character was slightly annoying. She's noisy, a cry baby, and doesn't know what she wants…. typical. \n\n
Overall, I enjoyed it because of all the male characters and usually there isn't a lot of reverse harem.  This is a 7/10 in my book.
